name: Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc.
description:
University of California, Berkeley chapter of Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc.

On Friday evening, November 17, 1911, three Howard University undergraduate students, with the assistance of their faculty adviser, gave birth to the Omega Psi Phi Fraternity. This event occurred in the office of biology Professor Ernest E. Just, the faculty adviser, in the Science Hall (now known as Thirkield Hall). The three liberal arts students were Edgar A. Love, Oscar J. Cooper and Frank Coleman. From the initials of the Greek phrase meaning "Friendship is Essential to the Soul," the name Omega Psi Phi was derived. The phrase was selected as the motto. Manhood, Scholarship, Perseverance and Uplift were adopted as cardinal principles.

U.C. BERKELEY QUES’ HISTORY MILESTONES
Ω Original chapter founded in 1925
Ω First Epsilon Mu line 6-10-83
Ω Epsilon Mu incorporated 9-28-84
Ω 2nd Vice District Representatives ’90, ‘96, '14
Ω District Chapter of the Year

Past Community Service Chapter Activities Include:
Ω Safe-sex & health awareness workshops 
Ω Academic programs 
Ω High school mentoring and tutoring
Ω Speakers series
Ω Feeding the homeless 
Ω Campus organization leaders
Ω Voter registration drives 
Ω Scholarship fundraisers 

Chapter Alumni Include:
Ω Past Basileus (President), Sigma Iota Graduate Chapter (Oakland)
Ω Former Basileus, Alpha Rho Graduate Chapter (Berkeley)
Ω Former 12th District Representative, 2012-14
Ω Many actively work in the community
Ω Senior managers in Silicon Valley 
Ω Former NFL football player
Ω Several are attorneys
�� Neurosurgery physician at UCLA

Chapter Academics
Ω 90+% graduation rate (bachelor degrees)
Ω 33% of alums obtained graduate degrees
Ω Weekly study groups
Ω Scholarship programs
summary: Omega Psi Phi Fraternity Inc. was founded at Howard University on Friday November 17th, 1911. Manhood, Scholarship, Perseverance and Uplift were adopted as cardinal principles. The fraternity was originally established at UC Berkeley in 1925.
categoryNames: CalGreeks National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC) Fraternities & Sororities
